reviewText:
First off: Don't be put off by my playtime. I own this game as a retail version and re-bought it on Steam.

Red Faction Guerilla is an open world game. It takes place on mars which is being colonialized by mankind and civilization there is currently in the state of terraforming and mining (so don't expect a city like you would in a GTA game or similar). That said, there is a fairly big map to explore with a whole lot of buildings, machines and structures which are fully destroyable. There are driveable vehicles and a small amount of weapons (of which some are very fun to play around with). There are RPG elements like the upgrading of weapons, health and some other useful things. Besides the main story missions (of which I don't want to spoil one bit), you can take on challenges, collect and destroy stuff to be able to buy upgrades. The story is not bad, but the focus in this game really lies on exploring and destroying..and if you're in for that, this is a straight buy for you.
By the way: The game was recently patched and got full Steamworks integration alongside with new MP-maps and a great community :)

reviewText:
I was obligated to play this game after scoring a free copy of Red Faction: Armageddon. I must admit, I came in a bit skeptical as the very early minutes of the game reminded me of Grand Theft Auto in space. The cars were crappy and its only gimmick was destructible environments.

An hour into the game, I found myself loving it. The plot is thin, but the plot was not what kept me playing. It's surprising to see such a simple gimmick go a long way. Not only was watching buildings get demolished fun, this game mechanic forced me to strategize on my feet. It gave me many options to approach a given situation. To my surprise, this was a thinking man's game.

If you ever see this game on sale, don't hesitate to purchase it. I picked it up for $5 a year or two back and it has rewarded me with about a dozen hours of fantastic gameplay. I eagerly await for more sequels from this franchise.

Grade: B+

reviewText:
Definitely in my top 5 games of all time. I originally had this on Xbox 360 but recently bought it on PC. The PC version is identical to the console version as far as I can tell. This game offers a unique perspective as a member of a resistance force who cannot fight face to face like in FPS games, but has to use clandestine methods to overcome the enemy.

PROS:

*Great destructable environment
*Unique storyline
*Original gameplay
*Excellent graphics considering its age
*Good range of vehicles
*You can crash your car into ANY building and attack anyone: this game offers a lot of freedom to the player, in a similar way to GTA, though simplified.
*Open world that is easy to navigate and you can go off-road wherever you want.

CONS:

*You need to install Games for Windows Live (the Microsoft equivalent of steam) to use and save the game
*DO NOT buy this game for the multiplayer experience. There is no multiplayer community and the servers are soon to be shut down. Do not let this put you off however, the singleplayer is great.
*It was clearly designed for consoles, so the console experience is generally better.
*Missions can be repetitive (they mostly involve blowing stuff up) but because the destructible environment is so good, you don't really mind.

To conclude, this game is worth buying if it's on sale, and you could spend a lot of time playing it. However, the game is more suited to console, so if you can, I would recommend buying the game for console rather than PC (though it could be more expensive). If Halo married GTA, this would be their child.

reviewText:
This game continues to deliver a constant great experience. With a surprisingly good story, an interesting setting and atmospehere, and the beauty of the Geo Mod 2.0 destruction engine, the game will keep you enthralled and playing. Speaking as someone who's only played the game on PS3 before, I can say that it gets even better on PC. There is a somewhat small modding community, but a modding community none the less, who unlock hidden content, make tweaks and even allow to have godmode.

Pros:
-You can tear builidngs apart, brick by brick using a wide array of weapons
-You obtain weapons such as remote charges that can be thrown and exploded at will, a rifle that disintegrates solid matter, a large missle that causes massive damage, a guass rifle, and a whole array of normal combat weapons.
-You really feel like you're fighting as part of a rebellion if you play it seriously
-There's a large amount of augmented vehicles that can assist you in the rebellion
-It's Open World!
-It plays out in a territory capturing kind of way. You force enemies out of sectors by lowering their control over the sector and rasing the morale and support for your guerrillas.

Cons:
-Buildings take quite a long time to collapse. An unrealistic length of time. This can be tweaked with mods though.
-Enemies are too powerful, and you can't hold enough ammo to deal with them all.
-No checkpoints on any missions
-Buildings don't respawn, meaning that you can't go back to destroy them again at the end of the game

I can confidently give this game a 10 of 10. Playing with difficulty enchancing mods can make the game somewhat frustrating when you die repeatedly on missions with no checkpoints.

reviewText:
Red Faction Guerrilla is Volitions version of Grand Theft Auto with a destructible world which makes it better than GTA.
But besides that, this is one of many underrated games people played it when it came out and after a year it was completely dead which sucked.
So, singleplayer, with the Steam Edition it comes with the dlc that was released for the game back in 2009. And the core game itself takes a few hours to complete but with all the side quests to do it takes up to 10 hours to beat.
Which is pretty good for an open world game.
The Multiplayer, you can still play with friends thats if your friends have it, but other than that its totally dead you can still play by yourself but it gets boring.
And theres an extra storyline to it that takes maybe 5 hours to complete.
The Graphics it uses the havok engine which is a pretty good engine for games this big. But for a 2009 game it still delivers. World size, its pretty big almost the same size as GTA and thats it. The combat system is pretty great actually, and the game made a huge transiton from a first person to third person view which people thought was pretty risky. But it delivered suprisngly well. The driving is exactly like grand theft auto almost. This concludes my review. I give the game a 10/10.

reviewText:
So, some people look at this game and see a Sci-Fi type game based on Mars where you can kill and destroy stuff. Well that's part of it. This game is like taking Saints Row, GTA, Mass Effect, and Battlefield's Levolution, and making a new game out of it. This game is probably one of the most fun games I have played. It's set in the future where miner's have made a society on Mars, but is threatened by the federal government. The EDF which is like the federal soldiers are controlling the whole planet, and you have to join a rebel group to take back the planet. Throughout gameplay, you'll definitley notcie that the developers have put in physics. So if you destroy a certain support beam, a building will come crashing down. This is something I really like. When I have an objective, I take a fast truck, thow C4 type stuff on my truck, and head it right for a building, jump out, and watch the truck ram into the building as I detonate it. It's great!
Pros:
-Physics
-Good story
-Great Graphics (Low end PCs can definitley play it: I play on very high, and get forty frames, and that's good for mine)
-Explosions
-Plenty of weapons, upgrades, and vehicles

Cons:
-The enemy AI seems a bit too over powered
-You have to click again to reload, and ammo runs out fast (It takes a good half a clip to kill on soldier)
-Every little thing sends unlimited EDF to you
-Gang banged by EDF and Natives (They seem to work together for some stupid reason)
-No way to defend yourself when you're a slow vehicle and they have trucks with turrets

Even with these cons, it;s still a fun and challenging game. It'll make you rage here and there, but it always has a way to draw you back. I do think that this game does need more updates, but other than that, it's defintley a game worth getting!

reviewText:
Like Armageddon, it has good graphics, great controls, cool weapons, ability to wreck almost the entire environment, and cool weapons. Although Armageddon has way better graphics and is optimized much better. This game lags if there is a ton of stuff  being torn down around me, Armageddon does not lag ever. Armageddon is linear and this game is more of an open world type game, but still mission and objective based so it doesn't make much sense to randomly explore the open world because it is a waste of time since you need to do missions and side missions and blow up points to get a good amount of salvage and push back the enemy to advance the game. It is a pretty good game and is a lot of fun, but it does have some crappy problems.

The biggest problem is that it has some of the worst sound I have ever heard in a game. The voices sound very tinny like in Half-Life 1, and all sounds in the game are very low quality, however HL1 has way better sounds than this garbage. The sound is â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing horrible.
Their idea of a challenge and the only real hard aspect of the game is that you can be doing very well on a mission then out of nowhere you are swarmed with guys and you die very easily so you are going to see game over a lot. Just a little dmg and I am dead so I have to be really careful always.
Vehicle control blows. My vehicle constantly takes way more dmg on missions than it should from the enemy because of the sucky vehicle controls. I am always ramming into rocks or buildings and coming to a dead stop which then allows the enemy to wail on me until I get going again, or flipping over/flying into things because vehicle jumping is very floaty. It is pretty much a problem with turning: for some reason, keyboard acceleration seems to be on when driving, so after holding left or right to turn for more than a second, it speeds up the turn and you instead of taking a turn smoothly, smash sharply into the left or right side wall.
Game is not well optimized. Lags like a son of a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ when a large building is being demolished around me. Armageddon never lags and it is a newer game.
Every time I alt+tab out of the game then go back, it is in a full screen window and I have to press alt+enter to get it back to regular full screen. Not a big problem though because I tend to not alt+tab out of games that much.

If it were better optimized and had better sound it would be a 8.5/10 but I give it 7.5/10. Armageddon may be more linear than this but that does not take away from its fun factor in any way at all. Even though this game came first, I highly recommend playing Armageddon before you get this.

Sound 4/10
Game 7.5/10

reviewText: You ever remember going to the beach and kicking down a sandcastle?  That sheer, cathartic joy of structural destruction crying out to the gorilla in the cockles of your heart, lifting it as that ever so ephemeral archetecture was undone by your besandled foot?  That's this game.  That is so this game at any given point.  Hammer, car, rocket launcher, remote mines.  Car covered in remote mines full of propane tanks propelled by rocket launcher.  All structures are yours to unmake and the joy of it is splendid.   The graphics and soundtrack are about standard, nothing to deride or write home about, but the gameplay.  THE GAMEPLAY.  Beat the game and you get fun cheats to sandbox destroy the surface of mars and everything on it.  The story mode is tolerable and when set to hard enough difficulty actually kinda fun to play through.  The side missions are the oven fresh cornbread next to that cold chicken that is the story mode.  Rescuing hostages in building, destroying a building with the missions weapon of choice, causing as much destruction as possible.  Brilliant gameplay and standard everything else a game needs to be shipped out all in this package.

reviewText:
Red Faction Guerrilla is a free-roaming third person action game set on Mars. This game departs from the FPS genre and while that might offput some (it did for me at first, but I got over it), it does well to distance itself from the failure of Red Faction 2.

Red Faction Guerrilla is one of the few games that I've actually played to completion. I loved the original Red Faction FPS game, can't say the same for RF2 and I was hoping this game would restore the franchise.

In the spirit of the original Red Faction, Red Faction Guerrilla totes a physicals engine that allows for physics based destruction of buildings. Unlike the original Red Faction, this game actually does produce gameplay around this aspect. The building destruction physics is fairly well executed and destroying buildings can be extemely satisfying.

8/10

reviewText:
This is a sandbox FPS in a destructible environment with much all-terrain driving, the best Red Faction up to now. Rebels come and go to help your endeavor to liberate Mars. The plot is thin but the Sci-Fi atmosphere in thick : free roaming on half-terroformed Mars, through craters and hills (but no mountains). Missions belong to several categories : free the prisoners, help defend an outpost or capture another one, stop a convoy, destroy a building, steal a vehicle and drive it to destination in a limited time, get in this big robot and destroy everything. They also become increasingly difficult.
After liberating a map you'll get access to following one, each map has a unique flavor.
Graphics are a little bit dull, but this is Mars, so who cares.
Combat can be intersting as you may destroy the enemy's cover or just blow them up.
Gathering metal from destruction allows you to buy improved weapons and means of even more destructions.
If only this game was made into an RPG !

reviewText:
8/10: You are a Terrorist similator.
Basically Red Faction: Guerilla is a 3rd person sort of open world shooter set on mars with a heavy, heavy focus on destruction.
Do you like blowing up/leveling buildings? Well, if so there is litterally no better game for you that isn't an indie game.
The shooting is relatively passable, the weapons interesting, the graphics are definitely suitable, and the story is kind of meh. There's driving vehicles, which handle relatively well although one or two early missions involving them are rather annoying.
The destruction though? Well, it doesn't always follow the laws of physics but it's fully functional and fully worth it. The game is basically Just Cause 2 with the tropical setting replaced with mars and the focus on movement and all around freedom replaced with a high fidelity destruction system and sci-fi weapons.

If you're considering buying this game, it's $20 so you'll probably be getting your money's worth on this one. The Steam Edition guarentees that it will run on your system without trouble. The multiplayer, while fun, is pretty much dead right now, but it is still fully fuctional in case you get some curious friends together.

Reccomendation: If you're interested, buy it.

reviewText: You ever remember going to the beach and kicking down a sandcastle?  That sheer, cathartic joy of structural destruction crying out to the gorilla in the cockles of your heart, lifting it as that ever so ephemeral archetecture was undone by your besandled foot?  That's this game.  That is so this game at any given point.  Hammer, car, rocket launcher, remote mines.  Car covered in remote mines full of propane tanks propelled by rocket launcher.  All structures are yours to unmake and the joy of it is splendid.   The graphics and soundtrack are about standard, nothing to deride or write home about, but the gameplay.  THE GAMEPLAY.  Beat the game and you get fun cheats to sandbox destroy the surface of mars and everything on it.  The story mode is tolerable and when set to hard enough difficulty actually kinda fun to play through.  The side missions are the oven fresh cornbread next to that cold chicken that is the story mode.  Rescuing hostages in building, destroying a building with the missions weapon of choice, causing as much destruction as possible.  Brilliant gameplay and standard everything else a game needs to be shipped out all in this package.
